text.p: Tropical Cyclone Gretelle, with 95 mph winds, is east of Madagascar in the southwestern Indian Ocean near 20s/53e. Gretelle is moving south southwest at 8 mph and is expected to turn more to the west southwest again this period. Top winds may peak at 105 mph in about 24 hours before slightly weakening occurs. Landfall is expected in 36 hours along the east central coast of Madagascar. Significant wind damage, flooding, and mudslides will likely occur as Gretelle approaches the shore and then makes landfall.

Tropical Cyclone Pancho, with 135 mph winds, is over open water in the southern Indian Ocean near 14s/89e, moving southwest at 4 mph. Pancho is expected to begin a slow weakening trend this period, but will still remain quite strong. The storm is a major threat to shipping but no threat to major land areas.
There are no further statements at this time.
